newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Bank of Israel maintains tight monetary policy.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Israel maintains tight monetary policy.

text.p: The Bank of Israel announced MOnday that it would not lower interest rates in December, disappointing financial markets but not surprising economists.
Economists said they had expected real interest rates to remain high over the next few months.
After the Tel Aviv stock market closed, the Bank of Israel said its key lending rate in December would remain at the present level of an annualized 15.2 percent.
The central bank, concerned with inflation, says it cannot ease monetary policy until the government makes a substantial effort to tighten fiscal policy.
Parliament has until Dec. 31 to pass the 1997 budget.
